titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Ruth Herschberger papers SSC.MS.00280
titlestmt.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-25 15:45:27 -0400.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.abstract: Poet; Playwright; Author. Manuscript of Adam's Rib (including revisions; and Norwegian and Swedish editions); and The Old Sex and the New; published books, articles and poetry; unpublished writings. Major themes in the collection include literature, sexuality, and the women's movement.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use with following restrictions on access: Accession #s 90S-29, 90S-39, and 90S-54 are open. Boxes 1-6 of Acc. 08S-19 are open. Rest of this accession (boxes 6-45) is closed due to preservation issues. Portions of collection are stored offsite; researchers must give 48 hours advance notice.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was gifted by Susan J Forbes from 1990-2016. The collection accession numbers are 90S-29, 90S-39, 90S-54, 08S-19, 08S-90, 16S-24.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born in Philipse Manor, NY, 1917; grew up in Chicago; attended University of Chicago, 1935-38; Black Mountain College, North Carolina, 1938-39; studied theatre and poetry at U. Michigan, 1941; and playwrighting at the Dramatic Workshop of the New School for Social Research, New York City, 1942-43. Wrote and produced plays for stage and radio; published book of feminist essays, Adam's Rib, under pseudonym Josephine Lang Staff, in England, 1948; published 2 books of poetry and contributed to anthologies; has received several awards for poetry. Participated in women's liberation movement of the 1970s; lived at Yaddo, Taos and Ossabau Writers' Colonies; resided for many years in Westbeth artists' residence, Greenwich Village. Herschberger died October 14, 2014.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: This online finding aid currently provides detailed description of only the most recent additions to this collection. Additional materials are described in unpublished lists that can be sent to you upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Ruth Herschberger Papers, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00280, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript of Adam's Rib (including revisions; and Norwegian and Swedish editions); and The Old Sex and the New; published books, articles and poetry; unpublished writings. Major themes in the collection include literature, sexuality, and the women's movement.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to unpublished materials may be owned by the creator, or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights. Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must also be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

did.unittitle: Ruth Herschberger diaries over fifty-three years, correspondence, writings and other materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restrictions designated by the donor: The restrictions applied to the accession record are the same as those applied at the collection-level. Restrictions designated by the SSC: The restrictions applied to the accession record are the same as those applied at the collection-level.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Diaries from age fourteen to eighty-seven contain entries about life as an alcoholic, relationships with lovers, financial struggles as a writer without a steady income, and descent into difficulties relating to old age.

odd.p: According to original box list, some scripts are "possibly by Herschberger"

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Diaries 1976, 1980 and 2001 were added to diaries in Acc. 08S-19
